meanings.definition: A mechanical device that allows continuous linear or rotary motion in one direction only.
meanings.sent1: The ratchet clicked as the wheel turned.
meanings.sent2: He used a ratchet to tighten the bolts on the machine.
meanings.sent3: The ratchet decided to take a break from clicking all day.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a ratchet, moving forward but never looking back.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the ratchet echoed through the garage.

meanings.definition: To cause something to increase or decrease incrementally.
meanings.sent1: She would ratchet up the heat slowly to warm the room.
meanings.sent2: The tension continued to ratchet up as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent3: He decided to ratchet down his excitement to avoid disappointment.
meanings.sent4: The negotiations seemed to ratchet tighter with each passing minute.
meanings.sent5: The music slowly ratcheted up in volume, filling the room.

meanings.definition: A person or situation that is unpleasant or difficult to deal with.
meanings.sent1: Dealing with her was like handling a ratchet, always tricky.
meanings.sent2: The project turned into a real ratchet with all the unexpected issues.
meanings.sent3: The ratchet of a boss made everyone nervous with his unpredictable moods.
meanings.sent4: The situation was a ratchet, tightening its grip on their plans.
meanings.sent5: The ratchet of a customer complained about everything in the store.
